alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued January 28 at 8:51AM PST until January 30 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM SUNDAY TO 1 PM PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Highest peaks of the North Bay could see gusts up to 70 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 32 possible. * WHERE...North Bay Interior Mountains and North Bay Interior Valleys. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 1 PM Sunday to 1 PM PST Monday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Sunday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will impact unsheltered and marginally sheltered populations, kill crops/sensitive vegetation, impact outdoor pets/livestock, and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
